briefdescription.para: In: File to be opened
In: "r" or "w", as with normal fopen
Out: On return *ispipe is TRUE iff file was opened via a pipe
Like fopen, but use popen and zcat if it is determined that "file" is compressed (i.e., has a .z, .Z, .gz, or .GZ extension).
In: File pointer to be closed
In: ispipe argument that was returned by the corresponding fopen_comp() call
Close a file opened using fopen_comp.
In: File to be opened
Out: On return *ispipe is TRUE iff file was opened via a pipe
Open a file for reading, but if file not present try to open compressed version (if file is uncompressed, and vice versa).
Start reading lines from a file.
Start reading lines from a file, skip comments and trim lines.
Move to the next line in the file.
Returns current line number.
Stop reading lines from a file.
Read a line of arbitrary length from a file and return it as a newly allocated string.

parameterdescription.para: The file handle to read from.
Output: if not NULL, length of the string read.

simplesect.para: allocated string containing the line, or NULL on error or EOF.

briefdescription.para: NFS file reads seem to fail now and then.

detaileddescription.para: Use the following functions in place of the regular fread. It retries failed freads several times and quits only if all of them fail. Be aware, however, that even normal failures such as attempting to read beyond EOF will trigger such retries, wasting about a minute in retries. Arguments identical to regular fread.

briefdescription.para: There is no bitstream decoder, because a stream abstraction is too slow.

detaileddescription.para: Instead we read blocks of bits and treat them as bitvectors. Like fread_retry, but for stat. Arguments identical to regular stat. Return value: 0 if successful, -1 if stat failed several attempts.

briefdescription.para: Return time of last modification for the given file, or -1 if stat fails.
Attach bitstream encoder to a file.
Retain pointer to a bit encoder.
Release pointer to a bit encoder.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this does NOT flush any leftover bits.

briefdescription.para: Write bits to encoder.
Write lowest-order bits of codeword to encoder.
Flush any unwritten bits, zero-padding if necessary.
Create a directory and all of its parent directories, as needed.
